plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical flowering plant known for its large, vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers which attract butterflies and hummingbirds.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates; typically blooms profusely in summer in subtropical regions
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions worldwide, including Southeast Asia, Pacific Islands, and parts of the US like Florida and Hawaii
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers typically last only a day before wilting but are continuously replaced by new blooms.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant with tall spikes covered in dense clusters of pea-like flowers. Common in meadows and gardens for its nitrogen-fixing ability.
plants.location: Native to western North America but widely cultivated and naturalized in Europe and New Zealand
plants.funFact: Lupines improve soil fertility through symbiotic nitrogen fixation in root nodules.

plants.name: Rhododendron macrophyllum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with large leathery leaves and spectacular clusters of bell-shaped flowers.
plants.bloomingSeason: April to July, sometimes extending into late July
plants.location: Native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States, especially coastal forests
plants.funFact: The Pacific Rhododendron is the state flower of Washington State.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: A water plant famous for its large round floating leaves and elegant fragrant flowers that rise above the water surface.
plants.location: Native to Asia, found in ponds and lakes across India, China, Japan, and Southeast Asia
plants.funFact: The sacred lotus flower can regulate the temperature of its blooms, similar to warm-blooded animals.
